column4: hey folks,i wanna to get higher than 640x480 resolution in ubuntu 8.04
have you enabled third party software souces?
go to system > administration > software sources and check off the two checkboxes under the third party tab, then check off the checkboxes beside proposed and backports under the next tab
then it'll automatically update your repositories, and shortly after it should automatically find a video driver for you to download
if it doesnt automatically pop up within a minute or two then go to system>administration>hardware drivers and look for your video card driver in there
my graphic card already installed but the highest resolution is 640x480
system>administration>hardware drivers  from here i enabled my card but still the highest res. is 640x480
after you enable the driver you should reboot your machine
installing the drivers is one of the few times you'll ever need to reboot ubuntu
i know ,i had rebooted machine before i join this channel
have you rebooted since enabling the driver?

you will want to find out about the xorg.conf file and how you can manually put your setting in there. when your driver is enabled but your resolution is still limited, its usually because of the xorg.conf file
yes, you are right, how can make that

when i had a similar problem i went to #compiz and someone in there was nice enough to look at my xorg.conf file and rewrite one for me, I don't really know much about it except that you can manually put all your graphics info in there to tell X how to use your graphics driver, i would recommend googling your graphics card and xorg.conf to see what others have done
